column4: does anyone know if the problem that made 11.04 not to work on HP laptops, has been fixed in 11.10 ?
can you expand on "not work"
installation goes fine, but then it doesn't boot.
which GPU?
ati and intel
oh, one of those dual 'hybrid' gpu things?
unfortunately yes
those things are a massive pain, and not unique to HPs
your question should have been "Do hybrid video chips work yet in ubuntu"
previous 10.10 runs fine... what's your take on 11.10? should i try it?
if it ain't broke don't fix it
i just want to try unity. thanks for your attention! :D
could try a VM, or use a live USB
will do. thanks for the help
if you boot to live CD you can chmod it there
i can't reboot
why not?
it's a server.

then you qwill need to plan a maintenance window to do it. You could use sshfs and then access it from another system at cli and chmod it there. You may be able to also reinstall the package which chmod is part of
nice
you can but its not advised nor supported. You'll more than likely end up with a big mess
